SCHOOL OF JOURNALISM
Office of the Director
September 25, 19$h
Dr, Gordon Ausmus
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
I need some information, Gordon,
and some of your expert advice. I see that the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters will be holding
its annual meeting in New York City October 27-30.
Will you fill me in on the NAEB and who makes up its membership, and
how it serves the educational field? As you know we are
moving into a pretty extensive program in the educational
fields of both radio and television, and it occurs to me
that probably we should have a membership in NAEB.
Do institutions take out memberships, or are memberships held by indiÂ¬
viduals who teach and work in the field of educational
broadcasting? If institutions hold memberships what is
the annual fee, and if individuals hold memberships what
is such fee?
Perhaps answers to the above questions will set me straight on the
forthcoming convention, but I am interested to know if
you think we should be represented at that meeting. I
shall appreciate any of your suggestions in regard to
our future relationships with this Association.
Incidentally, we are going ahead with construction of our studios for
both radio and television, but will have to await action
of Legislature next spring before we can proceed in
equipping the television studios. I see frequent mention
of your program and its progress, and while I suspect
you are not getting everything you want, I hope you are
getting sufficient support for an adequate job.
With sincere personal regards, I am
Cordially yours.
ROW/baa
Rae 0. Weiner
Director
